ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Warrior and skills question
ygData.msgSnippet: I would encourage you to work on all your skills, you ll not be sorry!  The epic is two 1hs weapons.  Of all the skills for my 30 Warrior, I ve enjoyed the 1hs
ygData.messageBody:
I would encourage you to work on all your skills,
you'll not be sorry! The epic is two 1hs weapons. Of
all the skills for my 30 Warrior, I've enjoyed the 1hs
the most due to the duel wield we get at 13, and then
double attack at 15 makes it even more fun!

However, I've come across some wonderful bargains for
2hb and 2hs weapons that had amazing stats and were
limited to warrior only or just a few other classes
and sellers kept discouting the prices due to having a
limited market. I landed a really fun 2hb weapon with
super stats and some haste for a few hundred plat. I
was forced to work on my 2hb then, but it's been worth
it!

I know a lot of melee classes that will switch out a
weapon they aren't as skilled in during groups,
especially when the situation is well under control
and there are more than one melee to help taunt. This
provides an excellent opportunity to help work on
those skills!

Have fun!

Nortic of Luclin
Bladze of Tribunal

--- Melanie Roark <melanie_6602@...> wrote:
>
> I'm currently leveling up a little warrior myself.
> Even though it makes fighting at a young age tough,
> I'm working on all her weapon skills. As a result,
> they are all fairly low right now. But I feel that
> later on it will be worth it. My RL boyfriend plays
> a warrior as his main and at lvl 51, he's only good
> at a couple of weapon skills. He's the one who told
> me to train in all weapon skills since you find some
> nice weapons later in the game.
> Rob LeBeau wrote:Ok, I have a level 11 warrior and
> would like your
> opinion on the following:
>
> I started wondering why I was not hitting that much
> with him even though he has a good weapon. After
> some
> research, I found that the reason I am not hitting
> as
> much as others is because I have been switching
> between 2HS and 1HS weapons to increase the skills
> of
> each attribute.
>
> Example: My skill in both is 25, let's say and my
> attack is at like 152. If I were to just use 1HS
> let's say, my ATK rating would be like close to 300.
>
> I have proved this because now that I am using the
> 1HS
> more, the skill is close to 30 and my ATK rating is
> close to 200 where with a 2HS weapon, it is still at
> 152.
>
>
> Would you continue to alternate both weapon types or
> would you just pick one and go with it?
>
> THanks
>
